intro: Kutchubaea micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered kutchubaea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
